text: "Muddy Mississippi Line" is a single by American country pop artist Bobby Goldsboro. Recorded on June 24, 1969 and released on July 18, 1969,"You've come a long way Bobby.", Billboard, October 5, 1974. p. BG-20. Accessed December 3, 2015. it was the first single from his album Muddy Mississippi Line. The song peaked at number 15 on the Billboard Hot Country Singles chart. It also reached number 1 on the RPM Country Tracks chart in Canada. ==Chart performance== {|class="wikitable sortable" !align="left"|Chart (1969) !align="center"|Peak position |- |align="left"|U.S. Billboard Hot Country Singles |align="center"|15 |- |align="left"|U.S. Billboard Hot 100 |align="center"|53 |- |align="left"|U.S. Billboard Easy Listening |align="center"|10 |- |align="left"|Canadian RPM Country Tracks |align="center"|1 |- |align="left"|Canadian RPM Top Singles |align="center"|37 |- |align="left"|Canadian RPM Adult Contemporary |align="center"|16 |} ==References== == External links == * Category:1969 singles Category:Bobby Goldsboro songs Category:RPM Country Tracks number-one singles Category:Songs written by Bobby Goldsboro Category:1969 songs Category:United Artists Records singles
title: Muddy Mississippi Line
